textos_fuente.text: Vendors - Rhythm & Ribs Home About Us Event Beneficiaries Gallery Sunrise Rotary Band Schedule Sponsors & Partners Vendors Volunteer Information Admission Directions & Parking Contact Us Sponsorships Buy Tickets Rhythm & Ribs Voted 2015 Best Festival in St Augustine | April 1, 2, 3 2016 Vendors Rhythm & Ribs Vendors Thank you to all of our vendors for being a part of what makes our festival successful. We are now accepting applications for the 2022 festival. BBQ Vendors Carolina Rib King Spartanburg, SC Camp 31 Brewton, Alabama Johnson's BBQ Chesapeake, VA County Road Provisions St. Augustine, FL Bryan's Sirloin Tip Meals Argos, IN FUN Foods Funnel Cakes Corn Dogs Fresh Cut French Fries Chicken Tenders Roasted Nuts Kettle Korn Shaved Ice Cotton Candy Candy Apples Fresh Squeezed Lemonade Fresh Brewed Iced Tea Coca-Cola, Diet Coke Bottled Water vendors@rhythmandribs.net All vendors must remain open during the Festival. Security is provided continuously from 10pm Thursday night through Sunday at 5pm All proceeds of the Festival are donated to fund community and international charitable projects. Vendor space available starting at $250.00 Vendor Applications 2022 Vendor Application Access our PayPal link HERE Hosted & Operated by the St. Augustine Sunrise Rotary and funded by our Sponsors & Festival Guests ¬© 2021 All Rights Reserved. Rhythm & Ribs

Also, when you buy with links on our site we may earn a finder‚Äôs fee. Click to see how we test and review products . YOU ARE HERE >> AmazingRibs ¬ª About Us: Meet The AmazingRibs.com Team ¬ª Meet AmazingRibs.com‚Äôs Team Of BBQ And Grilling Experts Meet AmazingRibs.com‚Äôs Team Of BBQ And Grilling Experts ( 38 Articles ) By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Published On: 2/14/2019 Last Modified: 6/16/2025 Share on: In the past, all the articles, recipes, tips, and technique on AmazingRibs.com were written exclusively by Meathead . That‚Äôs no longer the case. In 2017, we added some knowledgeable writers and editors to provide new recipes and reviews. While most of the content is still my own, I stand on the shoulders of some very helpful people, listed below. I would also like to thank a few other folks who have helped me along the way, all of which you can find here . Praise is cheap, but criticism is priceless. Jerome Goldwyn, Meathead's Dad Meet Meathead, The BBQ Whisperer, Mythbuster, And Barbecue Hall Of Famer By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Meathead is the founder and publisher of AmazingRibs.com, and is also known as the site's Hedonism Evangelist and BBQ Whisperer. Clint Cantwell, President Of AmazingRibs.com By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Clint Cantwell is President of AmazingRibs.com, charged with overseeing day-to-day operations of the website, as well as content creation. David Joachim, Editorial Director By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Editor of AmazingRibs.com from 2017 to 2021, David Joachim has authored, edited, or collaborated on more than 45 food books. Max Good, Vice President of Product Reviews & Keeper of the Flame By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer As AmazingRibs.com's Vice President of Product Reviews & Keeper of the Flame, Max Good is the man in charge of finding the best products. Bill McGrath, Thermometer Tester By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Bill McGrath is AmazingRibs.com's Thermometer Maven. He has sophisticated equipment, and an electrical engineering degree. Charlotte Wager, Marketing Consultant By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer As AmazingRibs.com's Marketing Director, Charlotte Wagner is the guardian of the AmazingRibs.com's overall brand. Aaron ‚ÄúHuskee‚Äù Lyons, Manager of The Pitmaster Club, Moderator By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Huskee is the manager of our Pitmaster Club and Comments Moderator on our public site. He's also a KCBS Certified Barbeque Judge (CBJ). Brigit Binns, Contributing Author And Culinary Consultant By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Brigit Binns is an editorial contributor. She is the author of more than two dozen cookbooks and runs a B&B and cooking school. Prof. Greg Blonder, Science Advisor, Mythbuster, Co-Author Of Our First Book By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Professor Greg Blonder is AmazingRibs.com's resident science advisor, myth buster, co-author of the site's first book. Henrik Oscarsson, Moderator By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Henrik Oscarsson is an AmazingRibs.com Pitmaster Club moderator. He was born in the southern part of Sweden and he lives in Stockholm. Sheila Ann Anderzunas, Moderator By: Dave Joachim, AmazingRibs.com Editorial Director Sheila Ann Anderzunas is a moderator of AmazingRibs.com's Pitmaster Club. Originally from Chicago, Sheila Ann now calls Long Beach, CA home. Ray W. Johnson, Webmaster By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Ray Johnson is AmazingRibs.com's lead vBulletin programmer, having heavily customized the software that runs the site's Pitmaster Club. Tamar Haspel, James Beard Award Winning Columnist By: Clint Cantwell, AmazingRibs.com President And BBQ Personality In addition to her work with AmazingRibs.com, James Beard Award winner Tamar Haspel writes the Washington Post column Unearthed. The Flat Top King, Recipe Developer By: Clint Cantwell, AmazingRibs.com President And BBQ Personality Neal Williams, a.k.a. The Flat Top King, fires up griddle recipes and cooking tips for the outdoor flat top griller! Chef Stef, Recipe Developer By: Clint Cantwell, AmazingRibs.com President And BBQ Personality Chef Stef is a lifelong barbequer and home¬†chef¬†with a passion for all different types of food, cooking, and techniques. Sterling ‚ÄúBig Poppa‚Äù Ball, World Champion Pitmaster By: Clint Cantwell, AmazingRibs.com President And BBQ Personality Sterling "Big Poppa" Ball‚Äôs passion for cooking outdoors has led him to have his hand in almost every aspect of the barbecue world. Dan Gertsacov, Roving Correspondent By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Dan is on a life quest to learn 50 cuisines from around the globe and to share those adventures with the AmazingRibs.com audience. Chef Rick Gresh, Product Tester By: Clint Cantwell, AmazingRibs.com President And BBQ Personality Rick Gresh is currently the Director of U.S. Culinary Operations for¬†AceBounce. He speaks as an expert at events around the country. Robert F. Moss, Barbeculture Writer By: Big Jim Maivald, Former AmazingRibs.com CTO Robert Moss is a highly respected authority on food, drink, and travel with a Ph.D in English. Click here to learn about him. John ‚ÄúSpinaker‚Äù Bowlsby, Moderator, Cast Iron Expert By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer John "Spinaker" Bowlsby serves as AmazingRibs.com's Comments Moderator. Spinaker is also an expert on cast iron cookware. Jerod Broussard, Moderator, Poultry Expert By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Jerod Broussard serves as a Comments Moderator for AmazingRibs.com. He is a maestro of the drum smoker and Texas barbecue. Malcom Reed, Pitmaster Supreme By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Malcom Reed is one of the most respected men in barbecue and his many videos make him a genuine YouTube Star. Kris Coppieters, Fixer By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Kris Coppieters is AmazingRibs.com's Lead Developer, managing the site's servers, all coding, and all technical troubleshooting. Alvaro, Senior WordPress Developer By: Dave Joachim, AmazingRibs.com Editorial Director Alvaro¬†is a Senior WordPress developer, with an expertise in many programming languages including PHP, Python, Ruby, and Perl. Jason King, Videos By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer In addition to serving as a video content creator for AmazingRibs.com, Jason King loves to cook and shoot videos. Jerry King, Pitmaster Club Cartoonist By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Acclaimed cartoonist Jerry King creates original barbecue and grilling cartoons exclusively for AmazingRibs.com's Pitmaster Club. Lisa Lynott, Artist & Illustrator By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer An artist and illustrator for AmazingRibs.com, Lisa Kolek studied illustration and graphic design at the American Academy of Art. Nate Maliwacki, Video Recipes By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Nate Maliwacki serves as a content creator for AmazingRibs.com, filming, editing, and producing instructional recipe videos. Dr. Antonio ‚ÄúThe Meat Geek‚Äù Mata, Meat Scientist By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer A meat scientist known as "The Meat Geek", Dr. Antonio Mata, PhD (10/7/50 - 1/14/22) was a contributor to AmazingRibs.com. Jeff McNear, Senior WordPress Developer By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Jeff McNear is our lead WordPress guy. McNear is an accomplished front-end developer who has extensive experience with CMS based websites. Greg Rempe, Pitcaster By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Known around the world for his two hour broadcast, the BBQ Central Show, Greg Rempe also produces a 30 minute weekly podcast. JT (Jeff Tracy), The Cowboy Cook, Interviewer Extraordinaire For The Pitmster Club By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Known as ‚ÄúThe Cowboy Cook‚Äù and a capable griller in his own right, JT (Jeff Tracy) loves to interview great cooks. Paul Sidoriak, Griddling Expert By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Paul Sidoriak's official title with AmazingRibs.com is Fire Starter because he makes things happen in his role as Director of Relationships. Candy Sue Weaver, Moderator By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer One of the best known and most respected people in the world of barbecue, Candy Sue Weaver is an AmazingRibs.com moderator. Chef Ryan Udvett, Recipe Tester By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Chef Ryan Udvett is a classically trained chef from Le Cordon Bleu in Chicago and serves as an official recipe tester for AmazingRibs.com. Rick Browne, Ph.B. By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Rick Browne oversaw product testing, reviews, and ratings for AmazingRibs.com. A renowned TV cooking show host, photojournalist, and author. Jim Maivald, Former SVP And Chief Technology Officer By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Jim Maivald¬†was head of our technical team for 15 years until he died in November 2023. He was an Adobe Certified Expert (ACE). Norma Goldwyn, Copy Editor By: Meathead, AmazingRibs.com Founder And BBQ Hall of Famer Norma Goldwyn is an AmazingRibs.com's copy editor and is Meathead's mom. She stays active editing, and guides art museum tours. Moss, Barbeculture Writer John ‚ÄúSpinaker‚Äù Bowlsby, Moderator, Cast Iron Expert Jerod Broussard, Moderator, Poultry Expert Malcom Reed, Pitmaster Supreme Ray W. Johnson, Webmaster Kris Coppieters, Fixer Alvaro, Senior WordPress Developer Jason King, Videos Jerry King, Pitmaster Club Cartoonist Lisa Lynott, Artist & Illustrator Nate Maliwacki, Video Recipes Dr. Antonio ‚ÄúThe Meat Geek‚Äù Mata, Meat Scientist Jeff McNear, Senior WordPress Developer Henrik Oscarsson, Moderator Candy Sue Weaver, Moderator Greg Rempe, Pitcaster JT (Jeff Tracy), The Cowboy Cook, Interviewer Extraordinaire For The Pitmster Club Paul Sidoriak, Griddling Expert Chef Ryan Udvett, Recipe Tester Rick Browne, Ph.B. Norma Goldwyn, Copy Editor High quality websites are expensive to run. If you help us, we‚Äôll pay you back bigtime with an ad-free experience and a lot of freebies! Millions come to AmazingRibs.com every month for high quality tested recipes, tips on technique, science, mythbusting, product reviews, and inspiration. But it is expensive to run a website with more than 2,000 pages and we don‚Äôt have a big corporate partner to subsidize us. Our most important source of sustenance is people who join our Pitmaster Club. But please don‚Äôt think of it as a donation. Members get MANY great benefits. We block all third-party ads, we give members free ebooks, magazines, interviews, webinars, more recipes, a monthly sweepstakes with prizes worth up to $2,000, discounts on products, and best of all a community of like-minded cooks free of flame wars. Click below to see all the benefits, take a free 30 day trial, and help keep this site alive. Click here to learn more and take a free 30-day trial membership Post comments and questions below 1) Please try the search box at the top of every page before you ask for help. 2) Try to post your question to the appropriate page. 3) Tell us everything we need to know to help such as the type of cooker and thermometer. Dial thermometers are often off by as much as 50¬∞F so if you are not using a good digital thermometer we probably can‚Äôt help you with time and temp questions . Please read this article about thermometers . 4) If you are a member of the Pitmaster Club, your comments login is probably different. 5) Posts with links in them may not appear immediately. Moderators Meathead Max Clint Spinaker Prof. Blonder Jerod Huskee Sheila Ann Click to comment or ask a question... FIRST PRIZE: Award of Excellence, National BBQ Association NOMINEE: World Food Media Awards MEMBER: International Association of Culinary Professionals LIFETIME MEMBER: Kansas City Barbeque Society MEMBER: Memphis Barbecue Network MEMBER: National Barbecue Association ORDER OF THE SCUPPERNONG: Southern Foodways Alliance FOUNDING MEMBER: Operation BBQ Relief REPRESENTED BY: The Lisa Ekus Group, Promoting A World Of Culinary Talent SUSTAINING DONOR: Global Alliance For Clean Cookstoves Member: Society of Professional Journalists Finalist: IACP Digital Media Awards Up Your BBQ IQ By Joining The Pitmaster Club Sign up for a free trial of the AmazingRibs.com Pitmaster Club and experience everything that the world‚Äôs largest membership-based BBQ and grilling community has to offer! Get a free 30-day trial here. Copyright ¬© 2005 by Meathead's AmazingRibs.com. Founded by BBQ Hall of Famer, Meathead, AmazingRibs.com is by far the largest and most popular BBQ, grilling, and griddling website with more than 2,000 free pages with tested recipes, product reviews, science, technique, and mythbusting. Our Pitmaster Club is a lively community with more than 15,000 paid members making it the largest BBQ association in the world. All text, recipes, photos, and computer code are owned by Meathead's AmazingRibs.com and protected by US copyright law unless otherwise noted. It is a US federal crime to publish or distribute anything on this website without permission. But we're easy! We usually grant permission and don't charge a fee. To get permission, just click here . And you don't need permission to link to us. Our Privacy Promise, Terms of Service, Code of Ethics. Meathead's AmazingRibs.com promises to never sell or distribute any info about you individually without your express permission, and we promise not to, ahem, pepper you with email or make you eat spam. We are GDPR compliant (the stringent General Data Protection Regulations from the European Union that went into effect in 2018). GDPR requires that we be willing to delete any info we have about an EU resident if you request it. We go a step further. We extend this right to anyone, EU resident or not. For more about our privacy promise, code of ethics, terms of service, and how we operate to insure you unbiased info, click here . Product links. We rarely recommend products we haven't tested and we never recommend products that we don't love. We have a rigorous product testing regimen . Often, but not always, if you purchase a product after clicking a link on our site we get a finder's fee. We recommend products based on quality and price, not on fees. These fees do not add to the price of purchase but they do help keep this site alive. Please use them. Contact Us. If you have questions related to barbecue or grilling, please post them to the comments section at the bottom of any page. Our talented team of paid moderators will be with you shortly. If you have business or technical issues, please contact us with this email form . This site is brought to you by readers like you who support us with their membership in our Pitmaster Club. Click here to learn more about benefits to membership . The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities. It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA. AmazingRibs.com is partially conformant with WCAG 2.1 level AA. Partially conformant means that some parts of the content do not fully conform to the accessibility standard. We welcome your feedback on the accessibility of AmazingRibs.com. Please let us know if you encounter accessibility barriers on AmazingRibs.com: E-mail: accessibility@amazingribs.com We try to respond to feedback within 2 business days. ¬© 2005 - 2025  | All rights reserved
  Meathead's AmazingRibs.com | The Science & Art Of BBQ & Grilling Since 2005 open sidebar

Volunteer - Rhythm & Ribs Home About Us Event Beneficiaries Gallery Sunrise Rotary Band Schedule Sponsors & Partners Vendors Volunteer Information Admission Directions & Parking Contact Us Sponsorships Buy Tickets Rhythm & Ribs Voted 2015 Best Festival in St Augustine | April 1, 2, 3 2016 Volunteer Rhythm & Ribs Volunteer Service Above Self Volunteers are the LIFE of Rhythm & Ribs! Come join in the fun and friendship! Apply to be part of our Volunteer Team by clicking the link below: Sign Up We really appreciate the giving nature and unique, professional skills that our volunteer community provides for charity events such as this one! Our Volunteers enjoy the following perks! Special, reserved (free) parking lot. (Must be on Volunteer List and show ID) Free gate entry. (Must be on Volunteer List and show ID) Free beverages ‚Äì beer, wine, soda & water while volunteering. 2022 Festival T-Shirt. Private, quiet area with nice bathrooms for breaks FUN networking with great people! Suitable tasks for responsible adults (21 and older) are: Entry Gate Admissions, ID Check (for drinking age), Beer booth and Cocktail servers, Grounds and Food Tent Cleaning Crew, Kids Games Tickets, VIP Party Staff, VIP Security detail, Sunday Breakdown. Suitable tasks for responsible young adults between 16 and 20 are: Grounds and Food Tent Cleaning Crew, VIP Security detail, Sunday Breakdown,BBQ Peoples‚Äô Choice Poller Suitable tasks for responsible young adults between 13 and 16 are: Grounds and Food Tent Cleaning Crew,BBQ Peoples‚Äô Choice Poller Your volunteer service counts as official Community Service hours! If requested, the Volunteer Coordinator will sign an official community service certificate for you at the end of your shift(s). Choose your task and time slot on Signup Genius: Note, the Signup Genius website works best from a ‚Äòreal‚Äô computer, as opposed to some mobile devices. If you have any problems with the signup website please contact volunteers@rhythmandribs.net for assistance signing up to volunteer. ***IMPORTANT*** WE NEED EVERY VOLUNTEER‚ÄôS FULL NAME. The best way to sign up friends, family and coworkers is for each person to sign up individually, so they choose exactly what they want, and they get email updates directly. If you want to be directly responsible for signing someone up, there are two options: If you want to add someone to work with you (like your significant other for example), choose 2 under Qty, and type the second person‚Äôs full name in the My Comment box . If you want to sign up on behalf of someone (like your sister for example), check the ‚ÄúDisplay as alternate name‚Äùcheckbox, then type in that person‚Äôs full name in the boxes that appear. If you choose option 1 or 2 above, remember that you will get update emails and will be responsible for relaying that info to people you‚Äôve signed up. Our festival relies heavily on our volunteer staff, so we ask that you be conscious of this and make responsible choices regarding signups . (Specific volunteer details and instructions will be sent out closer to the festival. So, make sure to provide a good email address, and keep an eye on your Inbox for emails from volunteers@rhythmandribs.net and SignUpGenius.) Still got questions? Please contact volunteers@rhythmandribs.net You will need to provide some basic information about yourself, and you‚Äôll be able to see available time slots and tasks to be filled for this year‚Äôs festival. The St. Augustine Sunrise Rotary Club sees this festival as a true service to our community, both in the proceeds we donate, and in the festival itself providing inexpensive, high quality fun and family entertainment. Each year, this festival is 100% Volunteer organized throughout the year, and 100% Volunteer run throughout the 3-day weekend. Hold on! ‚Äì That‚Äôs a LOT of work! Yes, but well, it‚Äôs good work, if you‚Äôre a part of it üôÇ The festival is a labor of love, and we could not do it without our many, wonderful community volunteers. Throughout the 3-day weekend, it takes over 200 volunteers working over 2,000 collective hours to make Rhythm & Ribs run. We invite you to come be part of this ‚Äúfeel-good‚Äù experience, and make new friends in the process. SEE YOU ‚ÄòON THE FIELD‚Äô! Thank you! Service Above Self! St. Augustine Sunrise Rotary Club Hosted & Operated by the St. Augustine Sunrise Rotary and funded by our Sponsors & Festival Guests ¬© 2021 All Rights Reserved. Rhythm & Ribs

How to Structure your Staff Team. It is strange how we operate on the‚Ä¶ | by Roonie | Netcord Articles | Medium Sitemap Open in app Sign up Sign in Medium Logo Write Sign up Sign in Netcord Articles ¬∑ Netcord is your Daily Dose of Discord. Read as the aspiring Discord community shares their tips on Community building, management, moderation, and so much more! How to Structure your Staff Team It is strange how we operate on the same platform without knowing a thing about each other‚Äôs staff structure Roonie 3 min read ¬∑ Apr 15, 2022 -- Listen Share Press enter or click to view image in full size Thumbnail: jsph#9999 Moderation is necessary for every Discord server. I personally run a 11k Discord server and I have never seen the staff channels of my friends Discord servers and they haven‚Äôt seen mine. But who knows what goes under the hood? How do we form a system so perfect and efficient? We just have to wait long enough to figure it out ourselves. This trial and error method feels kind of a waste of time doesn‚Äôt it? How many Moderators do I need? You may have asked yourself this question previously. What‚Äôs the answer? It depends on your server activity level. ‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt member count matter?‚Äù My old 100 member server can overtake my new 11,000 server in terms of activity any day. Funny enough, we didn‚Äôt even need moderators back then. Because we weren‚Äôt a community server. Just a few no life friends talking day and night. That is why server theme matters more than member count. The amount of members on your server, one way or the other, relates to your activity. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Start with three. I think three is a good place to start. Always remember, just because they‚Äôre active in chat doesn‚Äôt mean they are good moderators. Demoting someone is more work and trauma. Hire smartly instead. For the first batch, consider getting some of your discord-experienced friends As your activity starts to grow, and when you get outnumbered, or chat is active in the uncovered part of the time zones, that is when it‚Äôs time to get new staff members. Roles Structure Here‚Äôs my staff team role structure: Admin Moderator Trial Mod Management Pretty basic right? It does the job. ‚ÄúManagement‚Äù is the base staff role for all moderatos as a part of them being in the team. Have an administrator for around every 5 moderators. Unless you chose to have Senior Moderators. Staff Channels Structure: A private #staff-chat and #staff-commands is necessary. What‚Äôs also worth implementing is a #staff-guide handbook so new moderators know exactly how moderation works in your server. Mention in there what violations cause what type of punishment. A private #staff-news channel doesn‚Äôt sound like a bummer. You can use it to update moderators on various announcements only staff needs to know. You can also have a #staff-suggestions to let you staff members suggest different things to be implemented into the server. Proof of Violation: A channel for moderators to post the mod action they made against a user. They shall also mention why they punished the user along with a screenshot. Discord themselves recommend keeping track of mod cases manually. If you are a server owner, feel free to ask for suggestions or feedback on Netcord‚Äôs Official Discord server! We‚Äôd love to help you out. I was alone when setting mine up, you don‚Äôt have to! Thank you for reading ‚Äî see you tomorrow! Discord Discord Moderation Moderation Community -- -- Published in Netcord Articles 84 followers ¬∑ Last published Aug 28, 2022 Netcord is your Daily Dose of Discord. Read as the aspiring Discord community shares their tips on Community building, management, moderation, and so much more! Written by Roonie 173 followers ¬∑ 7 following Your local Discord enthusiast | Founder and CEO of NetcordHQ No responses yet Help Status About Careers Press Blog Privacy Rules Terms Text to speech

Smoked Barbeque Caterer in East Orange, NJ Skip to content Home About Us Menu Contact √ó Home About Us Menu Contact (973) 847-6098 (973) 847-6098 Home About Us Menu Contact √ó Home About Us Menu Contact Home About Us Menu Contact √ó Home About Us Menu Contact (973) 847-6098 Everything Done ASAP We Serve the Best Smoked Barbeque Dishes in New Jersey Discover More Everything Done ASAP We Serve the Best Smoked Barbeque Dishes in New Jersey Discover More Your Go-To for Delicious Authentic Southern Barbeque Savor the delectable Southern flavors of the barbeque dishes from Rhythm & Ribz Smokehouse in East Orange, New Jersey. We offer a wide variety of signature meats that are smoked to perfection and have hints of Caribbean flavors. Offering Dishes You Will Definitely Enjoy Our barbeque meals are smoked slowly over a low heat and are served with your chosen side dishes. We only want the best for our customers, so you can trust us to provide you with only the best quality food. Our Bestsellers While we offer many types of barbeque dishes, there are some that stand out from the rest. A few of the crowd favorites are: Tender Southern Smoked Briskets Well-Seasoned Smoked Chicken Succulent Pulled Pork Slow-Smoked, Mouthwatering Ribz Tender Smoked Turkey Breast Another must-have item from our menu is our appetizing homestyle mac and cheese. Like our other side dishes, this meal can be prepared in different tray sizes depending on your requirements. Let Us Serve Our Barbeque Meals at Your Event Our business also offers on-site services where we can cook and serve at your celebration. With more than six years of experience in cooking for corporate groups of up to 2000 people, we can handle providing our delicious dishes at your event. Our Party Packages Whether you are helping to plan your neighbor‚Äôs spontaneous gathering or celebrating a graduation, you can never go wrong with the Rhythm & Ribz Party Package. Depending on your needs, you choose between a package that feeds 20 or one that feeds 60. Ask Us About Our Barbeque Dishes Today With our commitment to excellent customer service, you can always expect great food and catering from us. For more information about our smoked barbeque meats and other dishes, get in touch with us today. We serve customers all over the tri-state area. About us - Who we are | Rhythm Corporate Skip To Content Our science & research Healthcare professionals Patients & caregivers About us Contact us Media About us Who we are Where we are Working for us About us Who we are Rhythm Pharmaceuticals is a global commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company focused on rare melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) pathway diseases. Our people immerse themselves in our values, mission and vision so we can create innovations that achieve meaningful positive impact on those living with MC4R pathway diseases. Pioneering a Path Forward Our Mission To transform the lives of patients and their families living with hyperphagia and severe obesity caused by MC4R pathway diseases by rapidly advancing care and precision medicines addressing the root cause. Our Vision The lives of patients and their families living with severe obesity are transformed through optimal and stigma-free care. Our Values We are inspired to tackle tough challenges and have the courage to ask bold questions We are committed to advancing scientific understanding to improve patients‚Äô lives We believe collaboration and ownership are foundational for Rhythm‚Äôs success We value the unique contribution each individual brings to furthering our mission We are eager to learn and adapt Rhythm Contact us Rhythm Pharmaceuticals, Netherlands B.V., Radarweg 29, 1043NX Amsterdam, The Netherlands Our Science & Research Scientific Overview Our Research Healthcare Professionals Patients & Caregivers About us Who we are Where we are Working for us ¬© 2023. Inspire Donate Scroll Register Today Register Today Dates & Locations Sunday September 28th and Sunday October 12th Location: Custer Baker Intermediate School 101 West St #44, Franklin, IN 46131 (map) Please see FAQs below! Fee $105 This includes clinics, registration, and the packet. Register Now X26 Audition Clinics Registration $105.00 Register & Download Packet Join the X26 Interest Group on Facebook Or Just Buy the Packet X26 Techniques Packet (No audition) $40.00 Purchase Not auditioning this year? Simply buy the audition packet and play what we're playing! The X26 Audition Packet includes all of the material the X26 battery and front ensemble will play to develop their technique PLUS bonus excerpts from our 2025 production ‚ÄúHands Of The Creation‚Äù for all sections. FAQ Where will Rhythm X be operating? Rhythm X will be based out of Franklin, Indiana again for the upcoming season. Individuals from any geographic location are encouraged to apply, as every season we have members and staff coming from across the country. Is there a Facebook group I can join? Join our Facebook group here to ask more questions, see who else is interested in auditioning, potentially find car pools, etc.: https://www.facebook.com/share/XiDjntGrpsDuRCGz/ What is the age limit? As per WGI stipulations, performers shall not be over 22 years of age as of 12:01 AM on April 1, 2026. There is not a bottom age limit to audition or attend the clinics, though most performers who end up making the ensemble tend to be age 18+. Can I do a video audition? In-person auditions are the best way to be considered for a spot in the ensemble. Attending in person allows us to provide personalized feedback and evaluate your skills in a live environment, giving you the best opportunity to showcase your abilities and interact with staff. Video auditions are reserved for exceptional circumstances and will be considered on a case-by-case basis. To be eligible for a video audition, you must have several years of relevant DCI/WGI experience. Exceptions to this policy are rare and are at the sole discretion of the Rhythm X staff. We understand the desire for feedback on your progress. We invite you to join the official Rhythm X Facebook interest group, where you can share videos and receive peer and staff comments. Please note that any videos shared or feedback received in this group will not be considered as part of the official audition process. What are the audition requirements for the visual ensemble (VE)? Due to the nature of modern Visual Ensemble, auditionees will be evaluated on site in regards to quality of Dance, Movement, Flexibility, and Adaptability. Auditionees should come prepared to showcase Technique in the Art of Modern Dance, including but not limited to; Jazz Dance, Lyrical Dance, Hip Hop Dance, Acrobatic Dance, and Contemporary Dance. The Expectation will be that all auditionees be led through a Stretch and Flexibility block. A Dance Basics and Dance Technique block, including Across-The-Floors. And at least two Dance Routines taught live, and evaluated on Comprehension, Technique, Performance Quality, and Adaptability. Can I audition even if I don‚Äôt live near Rhythm X? Yes! We encourage individuals from across the country (or globe!) to participate in our auditions. While Rhythm X mainly practices and performs in the Midwest, every year we have members from around the country. In the past, we‚Äôve also had members from Belgium, Japan, and Colombia. If you earn a spot, you‚Äôll have to make arrangements to move to Indiana or drive/carpool if you live within driving distance. What should I bring to auditions? - Audition materials printed out in a binder - Pencil - Water bottle - All sections may spend some time outside, so please make sure to wear comfortable & weather fitting clothing - Sticks and a pad for playing along (for battery auditionees) What is expected of me if I make Rhythm X? All members are expected to attend weekend rehearsals from Friday evening-Sunday afternoon from December through April, as well as attend a camp in between Christmas and New Years. Members also must be able to attend WGI Championships which includes events during most of the week leading up to Finals. Members are responsible for paying member dues; the dues for the 2023-2024 season were $2,100. Member dues cover rehearsal sites, equipment, contest fees, staffing, uniforms, props, and other ensemble related needs. During rehearsal weekends, members must make their own arrangements for housing, transportation, and food. Meals may be provided on show days. I bought just the packet, and now I want to audition. Please reach out to contact@rhythmx.org and we can give you a discount code to purchase the audition registration for $40 off (the price of the packet). What is the schedule for auditions? Schedule 8:00am-9:00am Check In 9:00am Block 1 12:30pm Lunch (You may bring lunch or drive to nearby food restaurants) 2:00pm Block 2 5:00pm Load & Dismissal Can I change the instrument or section I signed up for? Yes, when you arrive at auditions let the admin team know and we will make sure you go to the correct spot.
